project.model
Class Model

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      project.model.Model

public class Model
extends java.util.Observable

An example to model for a simple visualization. The model contains roads organized in a matrix. See Model(AnimatorBuilder, int, int).

Constructor Detail

Model

public Model(AnimatorBuilder builder,
             int rows,
             int columns)
Creates a model to be visualized using the builder. If the builder is null, no visualization is performed. The number of rows and columns indicate the number of Lights, organized as a 2D matrix. These are separated and surrounded by horizontal and vertical Roads. For example, calling the constructor with 1 row and 2 columns generates a model of the form: 
     |  |
   --@--@--
     |  |
where @ is a Light, | is a vertical Road and -- is a horizontal Road. Each road has one Car.

The AnimatorBuilder is used to set up an Animator. AnimatorBuilder.getAnimator() is registered as an observer of this model.

Method Detail

public void run(int duration)
Run the simulation for duration model seconds.

Throw away this model.

private void setup(AnimatorBuilder builder,

                   int columns)
